parts: Identify this ballet choreographer, often considered the most important of all time. A favorite of the Russian Imperial Ballet, this man also did the original choreography for The Nutcracker and Glazunov's Raymonda.

Petipa choreographed what is now considered the canonical version of this Tchaikovsky ballet. It centers on a prince who encounters Odette, a maiden who transforms during the day due to a curse by the sorcerer von Rothbart.

While at the Imperial Ballet, Petipa thought very little of this female dancer, who would go on to become one of the most important ballet pedagogues of the 20th century. This author of Basic Principles of Classical Ballet emphasized suppleness, aplomb, and conscious control as part of the method which bears her name.

answers: NAACP or National Association for the Advancement of Colored People
parts: Identify this state which saw a massive recount during the 2000 election due to problems with hanging chads and really confusing ballots.
This politician was Secretary of State of Florida during the election controversy. She was also accused of purging several eligible black voters from voter lists in the run-up to the election.
This organization sued Harris for purging voter lists; at the time of the lawsuit, this organization was headed by Julian Bond, though it is now chaired by Rosalyn M Brock.

answers: ham sandwich theorem or Stone-Tukey theorem
parts: This shape, which can be continuously deformed into a coffee cup and back, is generated by revolving a circle about an axis that doesn't go through the circle but is coplanar with it.

The genus of a torus is 1, because it has one hole. Thus, this value for a torus, symbolized chi, is equal to 0. For a polyhedron, it is equal to the number of vertices minus the number of edges plus the number of faces.
This useful theorem from topology states that it's possible to divide a collection of n objects in n-dimensional space in half using a single hyperplane.
Name these collections of the sayings of Muhammed, second only to the Koran in their important.
Of the 6 major hadith collections venerated by the Sunnis, this one is the most important. It contains an interesting passage about how the majority of people in hell are women.
This is the term for Islamic jurisprudence, which is based on the Shariah and the Hadiths.
Name this novel by Alan Paton that centers on Stephen Kumalo's search for his son, Absalom.
This minister of Sophiatown guides Kumalo through the town and the people they encounter, and helps him find Absalom.
This character is the defense lawyer in Absalom's murder trial in Cry, the Beloved Country. He argues that the decline of tribal society contributed to the crime, but he loses the case.
Identify this word, which describes a configuration across a double bond in which two substituents are on the same side. It is often contrasted with the trans configuration.
Using the Cahn-Ingold-Prelog priority rules, this letter designates a configuration across a double bond in which the highest-order substituents are on the same side.

In a cyclohexane ring in the chair conformation, this is the name given to substituents which project outwards in approximately the plane of the ring. A chair flip exchanges these substituents for axial ones.

answers: Judith Beheading Holofernes (accept equivalents like 'slaying' as long as they imply Judith killed Holofernes)
parts: Name this bloody biblical scene, a popular subject in art, which depicts the fate of an Assyrian general after he allowed himself to be seduced by an Israelite.

Although this artist's Judith Slaying Holofernes shares similar color tones with Caravaggio's, Judith appears to be throwing much more effort into it. The daughter of Orazio, this artist also painted Susanna and the Elders.

This female Bolognese painter, became one of the first women to paint religious and mythic scenes, such as her Noli me Tangere. She also depicted a rather seductive goddess of wisdom in Minerva Dressing.

Identify this Roman household deity and counterpart of the Greek goddess Hestia, who like her counterpart ruled over the hearth. She also lends her name to groups of virgins would guard fires in her temples.
These other Roman deities guard the hearths of individual homes, rather than the city as a whole. Statues of these household gods were present at important family events.

The 30 grunting Lares were given a place of worship by this figure after a sow had 30 piglets. This figure hosted funeral games in honor of Consus at the suggestion of his grandfather Numitor, and had an elite guard called the Celeres.

answers: "The Bishop Orders His Tomb at St. Praxed's Church"
parts: Name this poem in which a man requests "peach-blossom marble" and whines to his so-called "nephews" about being cheated by old Gandolf.
In this dramatic monologue by the author of "The Bishop Orders his Tomb," a beautiful woman is strangled with her own hair, and the murderer muses over the lovely corpse.
"The Bishop Orders his Tomb" was written by this poet, whose monologues like "Porphyria's Lover" and "My Last Duchess" were collected in Dramatis Personae.
Identify this action in which the German Third Reich annexed Austria.
After the Anschluss, Austria was renamed this, in order to ignore its history separate from Germany.

The Nazi-Austria fun house continued with the affair named for this politician, who served as UN Secretary General from 1972 to 1981. He was discovered to have lied about his Nazi past during his 1986 election campaign.

Identify this philosopher who also critiqued the title institution in "Marriage and the Population Question," and attempted to reconcile "the materialistic tendencies of psychology with the anti-materialistic tendency of physics," in his The Analysis of Mind.
Russell is perhaps better known for collaborating on the Principia Mathematica with this philosopher and mathematician.
Whitehead's major metaphysical work, based on his 1927/28 Gifford Lectures, is this one, in which the centrality of substance is replaced by an event of becoming called the "actual occasion."

answers: parallel axis theorem or Steiner's theorem
parts: Identify this value symbolized I, the rotational equivalent of mass. Multiplying it by the angular velocity gives the angular momentum.

This theorem gives the moment of inertia through an axis not passing through the center of mass. It states that I equals I sub cm plus m r squared, where r is the distance from the old axis to the new one.
This phenomenon occurs when two of the three axes of rotation are stuck into a parallel configuration with one another. It occurs in gyroscopes.
Name this lover of Maria Truczinski, who decides to stop growing on his third birthday.
Oskar Matzerath is from The Tin Drum, which forms this writer's Danzig Trilogy alongside Cat and Mouse and Dog Years.
In The Tin Drum, the Matzeraths watch a number of these creatures being extracted from a horse's head. Then they buy some and go home to eat them in soup.

answers: Mission Impossible: Ghost Protocol [prompt on "Mission Impossible"]
parts: Name this recent movie that features a scene of Tom Cruise character scaling the Burj Khalifa. The title "protocol" labels the IMF as rogue, but allows them to track down their enemies.

This antagonist in Ghost Protocol bombed the Kremlin to get Russian nuclear launch codes in order to start a global nuclear war. This Swedish-Russian nuclear physicist thinks this will make humanity stronger.

Ethan Hunt and Benji Dunn used a hi-tech projection system and dressed as generals to enter this building where those nuclear launch codes were stolen from. Its bombing led to the implementation of Ghost Protocol.
Identify this Muslim Indian dynasty whose members included the winner of the First Battle of Panipat, Babur, and his successor, Humayun.
This Mughal emperor and successor to Humayun set up the dhasala tax system and built his capital at Fatepur Shikri. He solidified several alliances by marrying Rajput princesses.

The Mughal empire also controlled part of this largest province in modern-day Pakistan, which was later controlled by the Durrani empire. This province has been attempting to gain independence from Pakistan ever since its independence, and the Khan of Khalat claims to rule it.
Identify this seahorse-shaped structure found in the medial temporal lobes, which are important in the formation of memory.

The hippocampus is part of this "system" in the brain, which also contains the Papez circuit, amygdala, fornix, and septal nuclei. This system is responsible for regulating emotion, memory, and behavior.

In the Papez circuit, the hippocampus and amygdala relay information to the thalamus through these two small ball-shaped structures on the underside of the brain. They are degraded in Korsakoff syndrome.
Name this factor of production along with land and capital, which is equivalent to the direct work done by human beings.
The classic example of this market structure is a single company that pays the same wage to all of its workers. This type of market has one buyer and many sellers.

This man argued that labor unions forming political parties lead to stunted economic growth in his The Rise and Decline of Nations. He also said that public goods will inevitably create free riders in The Logic of Collective Action
Name these objects that were eaten by the narrator of the poem "This is Just to Say," even though his wife was "probably saving [them] for breakfast."
"This is Just to Say" is a poem by William Carlos Williams who is better known for this poem about an object on which "so much depends." and that lies "beside the white chickens."
n this other Williams poem, based on a work of art, the narrator notes that "the whole pageantry / of the year was / awake tingling / near / the edge of the sea."

answers: the Romantic Symphony (NOTE: accept Bruckner's Fourth but don't say that as an alternate answer)
parts: Identify this symphony in E-flat, its composer's fourth, which the composer reluctantly described as depicting medieval knights and castles, though he mentioned nothing about love. Typical of its composer's symphonies, at least seven different versions are known to exist, leading to many headaches for scholars.
The Romantic Symphony is a work of this Austrian composer also known for his massive Te Deum as well as a symphony of which he was so ashamed that he labeled it as number zero.

This later Bruckner symphony in C minor, is his longest. The scherzo features a theme intended to represent "Deutscher Michel," while the 25-minute adagio is perhaps the longest in the standard repertoire. This work is sometimes named for its overpowering, stern character.

answers: Novus Homo [Accept answer reversed, prompt on  New Man]
parts: Name this conspiracy which, despite attracting large numbers of debtors and rebelling slaves, was prevented from seizing Rome by a man who would be known as Pater Patriae for his efforts.

This famous Orator and Consul was given the title Pater Patriae for stopping the Catiline Conspiracy. He is also famous for giving 14 Philippics against Mark Anthony and a defense speech for Milo, the alleged murderer of Publius Clodius Pulcher.
Cicero was one of these people, who were the first in their family line to ascend the cursus honorum to become Consul or Senator. Cato the Elder, Marius, and Tacitus were also given this moniker.
